summary: Route 66, established in 1926, was a famous highway in the United States, stretching 2,448 miles from Chicago to Santa Monica, California. It was known as the "Mother Road" and played a crucial role in American culture and migration, especially during the Dust Bowl. The route was popularized by a hit song and a TV series. Despite being replaced by interstates, parts of it still exist as scenic byways and state roads. It remains an iconic symbol of American travel and history.
title: U.S. Route 66
